intro: Pedicularis araratica, commonly known as the Arctic monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cold climates with short growing seasons. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a distinctive spurred structure that aids in pollination by specific insects. The plant's adaptation to harsh conditions makes it a unique example of botanical resilience in extreme environments.
